newsitem.title: USA: Pentair to buy General Signal pump group.
newsitem.headline: Pentair to buy General Signal pump group.

text.p: Pentair Inc said Monday it agreed to acquire General Signal Corp's pump group for about $200 million.

Pentair, which will finance the acquisition through existing lines of credit, said it anticipates that the acquisition will be slightly dilutive to the company's 1997 earnings but accretive to earnings within the first 12 months after acquisition.
The transaction, which will be financed through existing lines of credit, is expected to close by the end of the third quarter 1997, Pentair said.

The pump group designs, manufactures, and markets pumps for residential, commercial, and municipal applications through four brand-name businesses: Aurora, Hydromatic, Fairbanks Morse, and Layne & Bowler.

"The General Signal pump group, in combination with our existing (F.E.) Myers pump business, will make Pentair a major player in the worldwide water and wastewater pump markets," Pentair chairman and chief executive officer Winslow Buxton said in a news release. "This transaction is part of our strategy of expanding Pentair's presence in water products industries."
Pentair shares were down 1/16 at 37 Monday.
